Description: Production tax credit for battery cells ($35/kWh) and modules ($10/kWh), electrode active materials, and critical minerals
Battery Components Covered: Battery cells, battery modules, electrode active materials, critical minerals
Eligibility Requirements: Produced and sold in USA after Dec 31 2022 to unrelated parties
Phase-out/Sunset: Phases down 25% annually starting 2030 (75% in 2030; 50% in 2031; 25% in 2032)
Key Metrics: Credits trade at 92-95 cents on dollar; eligible for direct payment and transferability

Description: Consumer EV tax credit up to $7,500 ($3,750 for battery components + $3,750 for critical minerals)
Battery Components Covered: Battery cells, modules, critical minerals
Eligibility Requirements: 60% battery components manufactured in North America (2024-25); 50% critical minerals from US/FTA countries (2024); no FEOC components (2024+)
Key Metrics: $7500 maximum credit split between components and minerals

Description: Grants for domestic battery manufacturing and recycling facilities
Battery Components Covered: Battery cells, modules, packs, materials, recycling
Eligibility Requirements: US-based manufacturing and recycling projects
Key Metrics: Total $5B committed to ~40 projects; creates thousands of jobs

Description: Grants for battery materials processing facilities
Battery Components Covered: Critical minerals, electrode materials, precursors
Eligibility Requirements: US-based materials processing facilities
Key Metrics: Total $7B authorized over 5 years; Round 3 NOI for $725M issued Jan 2025

Description: Loan guarantees for innovative clean energy technologies including battery manufacturing
Battery Components Covered: Battery manufacturing, materials processing, recycling
Eligibility Requirements: Projects in USA demonstrating innovative technology; creditworthy borrowers
Key Metrics: $412B total LPO capacity; multiple battery projects funded including Li-Cycle, Redwood Materials

Description: Direct loans for advanced vehicle manufacturing including battery production
Battery Components Covered: Battery cells, modules, packs, components, EV charging infrastructure
Eligibility Requirements: Manufacturing after material mining; battery components and packs for EVs
Phase-out/Sunset: Modified by 2025 legislation (some IRA authority rescinded)
Key Metrics: $2.5B to Ultium Cells; $13B committed to 7 additional borrowers; $9.63B to BlueOval SK

Program Name: Defense Production Act Title III Battery Materials
Description: Presidential determination authorizing DPA for critical battery materials (lithium, nickel, cobalt, graphite, manganese)
Battery Components Covered: Critical minerals (lithium, nickel, cobalt, graphite, manganese)
Eligibility Requirements: Domestic mining and processing of critical minerals
Key Metrics: $89.95M to Albemarle (Kings Mountain lithium); $37.49M to Graphite One; $43M invested in FY2023

Description: Semiconductor manufacturing incentives with implications for battery supply chains
Battery Components Covered: Semiconductors for automotive/battery systems, mature nodes for EV applications
Eligibility Requirements: $2B designated for mature semiconductors for automotive/manufacturing; supply chain security requirements
Phase-out/Sunset: No sunset for appropriations; tax credits through 2026
Key Metrics: Supports battery supply chain through automotive semiconductors and advanced packaging

Description: Requires RTOs/ISOs to allow energy storage participation in wholesale markets
Battery Components Covered: Grid-scale battery storage, all storage technologies
Eligibility Requirements: Storage resources in RTO/ISO markets (excludes ERCOT); meet minimum size/performance requirements
Key Metrics: Removes barriers to storage market participation; enables revenue stacking

Description: Enables distributed energy resources including batteries to participate in wholesale markets through aggregation
Battery Components Covered: Distributed battery storage, aggregated DER
Eligibility Requirements: DER aggregations ≥100 kW; meets RTO/ISO technical requirements
Phase-out/Sunset: No sunset; implementation varies by ISO (CAISO complete 2024, NYISO 2026, ISO-NE 2026)
Key Metrics: Opens wholesale markets to distributed storage; enables virtual power plants

Description: Requires reliability standards for inverter-based resources including battery storage
Battery Components Covered: Battery energy storage systems with inverters
Eligibility Requirements: Data sharing, model validation, planning/operational studies, performance requirements for IBRs
Key Metrics: Addresses grid reliability concerns from increased battery/IBR deployment

Description: 30% ITC for standalone energy storage systems (≥5 kWh capacity)
Battery Components Covered: Standalone battery storage systems (grid and commercial)
Eligibility Requirements: ≥5 kWh capacity; begins construction before 2025 or placed in service before 2035
Key Metrics: 30% ITC for qualifying storage; direct pay for tax-exempt entities

Description: Increased domestic content requirements for federally funded infrastructure
Battery Components Covered: Battery components, EV charging equipment, grid infrastructure
Eligibility Requirements: 60% domestic content (2023); 65% (2024); 55% for EV chargers (2024+)
Key Metrics: Drives domestic battery manufacturing for federal projects; USMCA exempt

Description: US monitoring and potential restrictions on critical mineral exports; response to China controls
Battery Components Covered: Lithium, cobalt, graphite, nickel, other critical minerals
Eligibility Requirements: Varies by specific control measures
Key Metrics: Addresses supply chain security and China's export restrictions

Description: 30% investment tax credit for advanced energy manufacturing facilities including batteries
Battery Components Covered: Battery cells, modules, electrode materials, recycling equipment
Eligibility Requirements: Qualified investment in advanced energy property; domestic content requirements; prevailing wage/apprenticeship
Key Metrics: Round 1: $4B allocated to 100+ projects; Round 2: $6B announced

Description: Tariffs on Chinese battery imports: 7.5% general Section 301 + additional 25% on lithium-ion batteries (2024)
Battery Components Covered: Lithium-ion batteries, battery parts, materials from China
Eligibility Requirements: Imports from China subject to Section 301 tariffs; some exclusions granted
Phase-out/Sunset: Subject to USTR review and potential modification
Key Metrics: 32.5% total tariff on Chinese Li-ion batteries (7.5% base + 25% additional as of 2024)

Description: USMCA requires battery Regional Value Content (RVC) of 70% for duty-free treatment
Battery Components Covered: Battery assemblies for automotive use, battery cells, modules
Eligibility Requirements: 70% RVC for batteries in qualifying vehicles (phased in: 54% in 2020-2022; 64% in 2023-2024; 70% in 2024+)
Phase-out/Sunset: No sunset; permanent trade agreement terms
Key Metrics: Drives North American battery supply chain development

Description: Transportation safety regulations for lithium batteries classified as hazardous materials (Class 9)
Battery Components Covered: Lithium-ion and lithium metal batteries exceeding size/power thresholds
Eligibility Requirements: UN testing requirements, packaging specifications, labeling, documentation, quantity limits
Phase-out/Sunset: Ongoing regulatory framework with periodic updates
Key Metrics: Regulates air/ground/sea transport; special provisions for damaged/recalled batteries

Description: Streamlined handling for spent batteries under universal waste category; proposed expansion for lithium batteries
Battery Components Covered: Lead-acid, nickel-cadmium, other rechargeable batteries; lithium-ion under consideration
Eligibility Requirements: Reduced regulatory burden vs hazardous waste; collection, storage, transport, recycling requirements
Key Metrics: EPA May 2023 memo recommends universal waste handling for lithium batteries

Description: Developing national lithium-ion battery recycling strategy and potential regulations
Battery Components Covered: Lithium-ion batteries across all applications (consumer, EV, grid)
Eligibility Requirements: Under development; may include collection mandates and recycling standards
Key Metrics: EPA collecting stakeholder input through 2024-2025

Description: Fire safety standard for stationary battery energy storage systems ≥20 kWh
Battery Components Covered: Grid-scale and commercial battery storage systems
Eligibility Requirements: Safety requirements for installation, operation, commissioning, decommissioning; thermal runaway mitigation
Key Metrics: Widely adopted by local building codes; influences facility design and insurance

Description: Product safety standard for battery energy storage systems including thermal runaway testing (UL 9540A)
Battery Components Covered: Battery storage systems all sizes; grid, commercial, residential
Eligibility Requirements: System-level safety testing; fire performance; thermal runaway propagation testing under UL 9540A
Key Metrics: Required by most utilities and jurisdictions for grid-connected storage

Description: Authority to establish strategic critical mineral stockpile including battery materials
Battery Components Covered: Lithium, cobalt, nickel, graphite, rare earths for batteries
Eligibility Requirements: Domestic production prioritized; stockpile for supply disruptions
Key Metrics: Complements Strategic Petroleum Reserve concept for minerals

Description: R&D funding for battery recycling technologies, direct cathode recycling, hydrometallurgy
Battery Components Covered: Battery recycling technologies, second-life applications, material recovery
Eligibility Requirements: Competitive grants to national labs, universities, private companies
Key Metrics: Critical for developing economically viable recycling

Description: R&D for grid-scale energy storage technologies including long-duration storage
Battery Components Covered: Grid batteries, long-duration storage, flow batteries, other technologies
Eligibility Requirements: Competitive grants; target 90% cost reduction for LDES by 2030
Key Metrics: Supporting next-generation battery technologies beyond lithium-ion

Description: Requires pay-for-performance for frequency regulation; benefits fast-responding batteries
Battery Components Covered: Grid-scale batteries providing frequency regulation
Eligibility Requirements: Performance-based compensation in organized markets
Key Metrics: Enabled early battery grid market participation; foundational for storage economics

Description: Third-party provision of ancillary services; enables non-utility battery operators
Battery Components Covered: Battery storage providing ancillary services to transmission
Eligibility Requirements: Allows third parties to provide services beyond traditional utilities
Key Metrics: Opened market to independent battery operators

Description: Formula grants to states for energy programs; can include battery storage and EV charging
Battery Components Covered: Energy efficiency and renewable energy including storage
Eligibility Requirements: States design programs; some include battery incentives
Key Metrics: Flexible funding enabling state-level battery programs

Description: Proposed additional credits for domestic critical mineral production
Battery Components Covered: Lithium, cobalt, nickel, graphite mining and processing
Eligibility Requirements: Would incentivize domestic mineral production
Key Metrics: Multiple proposals in Congress; not yet law

Description: Tariffs and trade restrictions on battery materials from China
Battery Components Covered: Graphite, cathode/anode materials, electrolyte components
Eligibility Requirements: Additional tariffs on specific battery components beyond finished cells
Key Metrics: Aims to onshore material processing

Description: Domestic content requirements for batteries in federally funded vehicles and infrastructure
Battery Components Covered: Batteries in transit buses, government vehicles, charging infrastructure
Eligibility Requirements: 55-100% domestic content depending on application and timeline; USMCA content counts
Key Metrics: Drives domestic battery manufacturing for federal projects
